use_case: Building AI-first funnel with full automation
prompt:
Design a fully AI-automated sales funnel for [product/service] with minimal human intervention:

1. AI components:
   - Chatbot for lead qualification (24/7)
   - Predictive lead scoring and routing
   - Dynamic content personalization
   - Automated email responses
   - AI-powered recommendations
   - Smart scheduling and follow-ups

2. Human handoff points:
   - High-value opportunity thresholds
   - Complex question escalation
   - Final negotiation and closing
   - VIP customer handling

3. AI training and optimization:
   - Initial training data requirements
   - Continuous learning from interactions
   - Performance monitoring and tuning
   - Edge case handling

4. Technical architecture:
   - AI platform selection (OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.)
   - Integration with existing tools
   - Data pipeline and storage
   - Security and privacy considerations

Provide complete AI funnel architecture, implementation roadmap, and code examples. Include ROI calculations and scaling projections. Target: 80%+ automation of funnel interactions.
description: Creates cutting-edge funnel leveraging latest AI capabilities. Can handle 80%+ of interactions without human involvement while maintaining personalization. Represents future of sales funnel automation and scalability.

prompt:
Create a REST API endpoint that:
- Accepts POST requests at /api/users
- Validates input (name, email, age)
- Stores data in [database]
- Returns appropriate status codes
- Includes error handling for duplicate emails
- Implements rate limiting

Use [Express/FastAPI/Django] and include input sanitization.
description: API endpoint creation with comprehensive requirements. Specify the framework, validation rules, and security measures needed.

prompt:
Set up API integration with [service]:
- Create service layer for API calls
- Implement authentication headers
- Error handling with retry logic
- Request/response interceptors
- Loading states management
- Data caching strategy

Use Axios or Fetch with proper TypeScript types.
description: API integration with robust error handling. Create a service layer to centralize API logic.

use_case: Designing a team or about section with engaging member profiles
prompt: Create an appealing team section that humanizes your brand and builds connection. Team section structure: (1) Section header: 'Meet the Team' or 'Our Team' headline, Brief intro about team culture or values, Optional team photo/group shot, (2) Team member cards: Grid layout (3-4 columns desktop, 2 tablet, 1 mobile), Consistent card size and styling, Professional photos (same style/background), Member name and title, Brief bio or personal fun fact (2-3 lines), Social media links (LinkedIn, Twitter), Optional 'Meet [Name]' link to full bio, (3) Visual design: Circular or rounded square photos, Hover effects (color overlay, flip to reveal more info), Grayscale photos with color on hover, Consistent brand colors in card design, (4) Content strategy: Show personality (not just credentials), Diversity and inclusion representation, Behind-the-scenes candid photos option, Team values or culture highlights, (5) Interactive elements: Filter by department or role, Expandable cards for full bios, Photo gallery or carousel option. Ensure accessibility with proper alt text. Keep photos current and professional yet personable.
description: Creates engaging team sections that build trust and human connection. Showing real team members increases trust by 25%+ and helps visitors connect with the brand. Important for service businesses and B2B companies.

prompt:
Add keyboard shortcuts:
- Define shortcuts for common actions
- Show shortcuts panel (? key)
- Support Mac and Windows key combos
- Prevent conflicts with browser shortcuts
- Add visual feedback when triggered

Accessible for screen readers.
description: Keyboard shortcuts for power users. Document shortcuts and make them discoverable.

use_case: Creating an accessible and inclusive homepage meeting WCAG AA standards
prompt: Design a fully accessible homepage that meets WCAG 2.1 AA compliance and ensures inclusive user experiences. Requirements: (1) Color contrast: Minimum 4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text (18px+), never rely on color alone for information, (2) Keyboard navigation: All interactive elements accessible via Tab key, visible focus indicators with 3px outline, logical tab order, (3) Screen reader support: Semantic HTML5 elements, descriptive alt text for all images (or alt='' for decorative), ARIA labels for interactive components, heading hierarchy (H1-H6) properly structured, (4) Forms: Clear labels, error messages, and instructions, (5) Responsive to user preferences: Respect prefers-reduced-motion, support dark mode with prefers-color-scheme, (6) Minimum touch targets: 44x44px for mobile, (7) Readable typography: 16px minimum, resizable text up to 200% without breaking layout. Test with WAVE, axe DevTools, and actual screen readers.
description: Ensures homepage is usable by everyone, including users with disabilities. Accessibility is increasingly required for awards consideration and expands potential audience by 15%+. Based on WCAG standards and inclusive design principles.

Create a comprehensive analytics tracking system for [sales funnel] with:

1. Key metrics to track:
   - Funnel stage conversion rates

   - Alert systems for anomalies
   - Cohort analysis views

3. Implementation:
   - Google Analytics 4 setup guide
   - Custom event tracking code
   - UTM parameter strategy
   - Heatmap and session recording tools

4. Reporting:
   - Weekly performance report template
   - Monthly optimization recommendations
   - Quarterly strategic review format

Provide code snippets for tracking implementation and dashboard creation. Include sample SQL queries for advanced analysis.
description: Establishes comprehensive tracking and reporting for data-driven funnel optimization. Provides visibility into performance at every stage. Essential for identifying opportunities and measuring ROI.

use_case: Implementing predictive analytics for funnel optimization

Set up predictive analytics system to optimize [sales funnel]:

1. Data collection:

   - Conversion event logging
   - Feature usage monitoring
   - Customer attribute data

2. Predictive models:
   - Lead scoring (conversion probability)
   - Churn prediction
   - Lifetime value forecasting
   - Next best action recommendations

3. Activation and automation:
   - Real-time scoring and segmentation
   - Automated nurture path assignment
   - Dynamic content personalization
   - Sales alert triggers

4. Continuous improvement:
   - Model performance monitoring
   - Feedback loop implementation
   - Regular retraining schedule
   - A/B testing of predictions

Provide technical architecture, implementation guide with code samples, and KPI dashboard design. Include tool recommendations (Python, TensorFlow, cloud ML services).
description: Uses machine learning to predict outcomes and optimize funnel in real-time. Can increase conversion rates by 20-40% through better targeting. Requires data infrastructure but provides significant competitive advantage.

use_case: Creating post-purchase satisfaction survey for continuous improvement
prompt:
Design a post-purchase feedback system that drives funnel optimization:

1. Survey design:
   - Net Promoter Score (NPS) question
   - Customer Satisfaction (CSAT) rating
   - Customer Effort Score (CES)
   - Open-ended feedback questions
   - Specific funnel touchpoint ratings

2. Timing and delivery:
   - Immediate post-purchase survey
   - Post-delivery/onboarding survey
   - 30-day experience survey
   - Channel selection (email, SMS, in-app)

3. Data analysis:
   - Sentiment analysis
   - Common theme identification
   - Correlation with conversion metrics
   - Detractor follow-up protocol

4. Action and optimization:
   - Feedback-driven funnel improvements
   - Quick wins implementation
   - Long-term optimization roadmap
   - Closing the loop with respondents

Provide survey templates, analysis framework, and action planning guide. Include code for automated survey delivery and analysis.
description: Creates systematic process for capturing customer feedback and using it for optimization. Identifies blind spots and improvement opportunities. Essential for continuous funnel improvement and customer-centric approach.

use_case: Building a homepage with scroll-triggered number animations and data reveals
prompt: Design an impactful statistics section with scroll-triggered animations that highlight key metrics. Animation implementation: (1) Number counter animations: Numbers that count up from 0 when scrolled into view, Use easing function for natural feel (start slow, accelerate, slow at end), Duration: 1.5-2.5 seconds depending on number size, Format large numbers with commas (1,000,000), Include + or % symbols where appropriate, (2) Trigger mechanics: Use Intersection Observer API for scroll detection, Trigger when element is 20-30% in viewport, Animate once (don't repeat on scroll up/down), Fallback: Show final numbers if JavaScript disabled, (3) Visual design: Large, bold numbers (56-80px), Descriptive labels below numbers (16-20px), Icons or illustrations accompanying stats, Grid layout for multiple stats (3-4 per row), Background section to highlight importance, (4) Additional effects: Fade-in animation combined with counting, Slide-up entrance animation, Progress bars that fill to percentage, Chart animations (bar heights, pie fills), (5) Content strategy: Use impressive, round numbers, Be specific with metrics ('50,000+', not 'thousands'), Include context or comparison. Ensure animations are smooth on all devices. Test performance with many animated elements.
description: Creates engaging data presentations that capture attention and communicate scale. Animated statistics increase information retention by 40%+ and create wow moments. Commonly used in About pages and marketing homepages.

prompt:
Add smooth scroll animations using:
- Intersection Observer for fade-in effects
- Parallax scrolling for hero section
- Stagger animations for list items
- Page transitions

Use Framer Motion or CSS animations. Keep animations subtle and performance-friendly.
description: Animation implementation with performance considerations. Specify animation library preference and performance constraints.

prompt:
Implement cursor/pointer effects:
- Custom cursor design
- Hover effects on interactive elements
- Magnetic cursor on buttons
- Trailing effects
- Smooth transitions
- Disable on touch devices

Keep subtle and not distracting.
description: Custom cursor effects. Use sparingly and ensure it doesn't hurt usability.

prompt:
Add user authentication to this app using [Supabase/Auth0/Firebase]. Include:
- Sign up with email/password
- Login with email/password
- Password reset functionality
- Protected routes that redirect to login
- Secure session management

Use environment variables for API keys. Follow OWASP security guidelines.
description: Comprehensive authentication prompt with security best practices. Always specify the auth provider and security requirements.

prompt:
Implement OAuth social login:
- Sign in with [Google/GitHub/Twitter]
- Handle OAuth flow
- Link multiple accounts
- Fallback to email/password
- Request minimal permissions
- Secure token storage

Use NextAuth or Passport.js.
description: OAuth social login integration. Use established library for security and ease of implementation.

use_case: Implementing Awwwards-winning minimalist design with maximalist interactions
prompt: Create a homepage that embodies the 2025 award-winning trend of minimalist aesthetics with rich interactions. Design approach: (1) Visual simplicity: Clean white/light backgrounds, ample whitespace (40%+ of layout), limited color palette (2-3 colors), simple geometric shapes, (2) Typography-focused: Large, bold typography as the main visual element, creative text animations (split text reveals, gradient fills), hierarchy through size and weight alone, (3) Sophisticated micro-interactions: Hover effects with smooth transitions (300ms ease-out), Cursor changes with custom cursors, Button morphing and ripple effects, Smooth page transitions between sections, (4) Subtle animations: Elements that respond to scroll position, Parallax effects on backgrounds, Staggered fade-ins for lists, (5) Performance: Despite rich interactions, maintain fast load times using CSS transforms, Respect prefers-reduced-motion. Reference: Apple's product pages, Stripe's homepage, Awwwards SOTD winners.
description: Implements the leading trend in award-winning web design combining clean aesthetics with delightful interactions. This approach wins Awwwards recognition while maintaining usability and performance. Based on 2025 design trends from Seahawkmedia research.

use_case: Implementing account-based marketing funnel for B2B
prompt:
Create an account-based marketing (ABM) funnel for [B2B product/service]:

1. Account selection:
   - Ideal customer profile definition
   - Account scoring and prioritization
   - Stakeholder mapping within accounts
   - Research and intelligence gathering

2. Personalized engagement:
   - Account-specific landing pages
   - Personalized content and messaging
   - Multi-threaded outreach strategy
   - Executive-level engagement tactics

3. Channel orchestration:
   - LinkedIn advertising to target accounts
   - Direct mail campaigns
   - Personalized email sequences
   - Events and networking

4. Sales enablement:
   - Account insights and intelligence
   - Trigger event notifications
   - Buying committee engagement tracking
   - Handoff optimization to sales

Provide ABM playbook, personalization templates, and account journey maps. Target: 3x higher close rates vs traditional funnel.
description: Creates highly targeted funnel for specific high-value accounts. More effective than broad funnel for enterprise sales. Can reduce sales cycles by 40% and increase deal sizes significantly.

use_case: Establishing strong brand identity and visual consistency across homepage
prompt: Create a homepage that powerfully communicates brand identity with absolute consistency. Brand elements: (1) Logo: Prominent placement in top-left, consistent sizing across pages (150-200px width), proper spacing (minimum 20px clearance), (2) Color palette: Define primary brand colors (2-3 colors) used consistently across all elements, create a color system with documented hex codes, (3) Typography: Establish brand font families (heading + body), consistent sizes and weights, (4) Imagery style: Consistent photography style (e.g., lifestyle, product shots, illustrations), unified filters or color treatments, (5) Voice and tone: Consistent copywriting style reflecting brand personality (professional, playful, authoritative), (6) Design elements: Signature shapes, patterns, or graphic elements used throughout, (7) Spacing system: Consistent padding and margins using 8px baseline grid. Create a cohesive emotional experience that users can instantly recognize as your brand.
description: Builds strong brand recognition and trust through consistent visual identity. Consistent branding can increase revenue by 33% and improves memorability. Essential for award-winning designs that stand out while maintaining cohesion.

use_case: Implementing seasonal campaign funnels with urgency
prompt:
Create seasonal/holiday campaign funnel for [product/service] maximizing limited-time urgency:

1. Campaign planning:
   - Calendar of key dates (Black Friday, holidays, etc.)
   - Campaign themes and angles
   - Offer structure and discounting strategy
   - Inventory and capacity planning

2. Pre-launch sequence:
   - Teaser campaigns building anticipation
   - Early access for VIP customers
   - Waitlist and notification signup
   - Countdown and reminder sequence

3. Launch execution:
   - High-impact launch messaging
   - Multi-channel coordination
   - Real-time inventory and urgency updates
   - Deal progression (increasing urgency)

4. Post-campaign:
   - Last chance messaging
   - Non-buyer win-back attempts
   - Thank you and retention focus
   - Data analysis and lessons learned

Provide campaign calendar, email sequences, ad creative briefs, and performance tracking dashboard. Include year-round promotional calendar template.
description: Maximizes revenue during key seasonal periods. Seasonal campaigns can drive 30-50% of annual revenue for many businesses. Requires careful planning and execution across multiple channels.

use_case: Creating a color psychology-driven homepage with strategic palette selection
prompt: Design a homepage using color psychology principles tailored to the brand's emotional goals. Research-backed color applications: (1) For trust/security brands: Navy blue (#1E3A8A) primary with green (#10B981) accents for CTAs, (2) For energy/urgency brands: Orange (#F97316) primary with yellow (#FCD34D) highlights, (3) For luxury/sophistication: Black (#0F172A) with gold (#F59E0B) or silver (#94A3B8) accents, (4) For health/wellness: Sage green (#84CC16) with earth tones. Implement: 60-30-10 color rule (60% dominant, 30% secondary, 10% accent), high contrast ratio (minimum 4.5:1 for WCAG AA) between text and backgrounds, color gradients for depth, color blocking to group related content, consistent brand colors across all elements. Use bright colors sparingly for CTA emphasis. Include hover states with color transitions.
description: Applies evidence-based color psychology to evoke specific emotions and drive actions. Colors can increase brand recognition by 80% and improve readability when properly contrasted. Based on award-winning design patterns from Awwwards and CSSDA.

use_case: Building a contact section with interactive map and multiple contact methods
prompt: Design a comprehensive contact section that makes reaching out easy and appealing. Contact components: (1) Contact form: Fields: Name, Email, Phone (optional), Subject dropdown, Message textarea, Submit button with loading state, Success message on submission, Email notification to business, Auto-reply to user, Form validation with helpful error messages, (2) Interactive map: Embedded Google Maps showing location, Custom pin with brand colors, 'Get Directions' link, Satellite/street view toggle, (3) Contact information grid: Office address with map icon, Phone number (clickable tel: link), Email (clickable mailto: link), Business hours with clock icon, Social media links with brand icons, (4) Alternative contact methods: Live chat widget integration, WhatsApp button (mobile), Schedule call/meeting button, (5) Design elements: Contact section with distinct background color, Office photo or team photo, Quick response time promise, 'We typically respond within 24 hours'. Ensure form is accessible and mobile-friendly. Implement reCAPTCHA for spam prevention.
description: Creates effective contact sections that increase inquiry rates by making communication easy and trustworthy. Multiple contact options accommodate different user preferences. Well-designed contact forms can increase submissions by 120%.

use_case: Creating a blog-focused homepage with content discovery features
prompt: Design a homepage optimized for blog content discovery and readership. Layout structure: (1) Featured post: Large hero card with cover image, Headline, excerpt (2-3 lines), Author, date, read time, Category tag, (2) Recent posts grid: 3-column grid on desktop, 1-column on mobile, Smaller cards with images, titles, excerpts, Hover effects (image zoom, shadow lift), (3) Category navigation: Horizontal category pills/tabs, Filter content by category without page reload, Visual category icons, (4) Sidebar elements: Author bio with photo, Newsletter signup form, Popular posts list, Social media links, Tag cloud or search, (5) Pagination or infinite scroll: 'Load More' button, Smooth loading animation, Progress indicator, (6) Post metadata: Reading time estimate, Comment count, Social share buttons. Optimize for content readability: use serif fonts for articles, maintain 720px max-width for post content, generous line height. Include RSS feed link.
description: Creates engaging blog homepages that maximize content discovery and readership. Well-designed blog homepages can increase pageviews by 40%+ and time-on-site. Based on successful publishing site patterns.

use_case: Designing a FAQ section with accordion interface and search
prompt: Create a comprehensive, user-friendly FAQ section for homepage inclusion. FAQ structure: (1) Section header: 'Frequently Asked Questions' heading, Brief intro text, Search bar for FAQ filtering, (2) Accordion interface: Questions as clickable headers with + icon, Smooth expand/collapse animation (300ms), Only one open at a time or allow multiple, Answers in readable paragraph format with bullets if needed, (3) Organization: Group by category with category headers, Most asked questions at top, Logical flow from general to specific, (4) Content strategy: Questions written in natural language (how users ask), Answers concise but complete (100-200 words), Include links to detailed articles, Address common objections or concerns, (5) Functionality: Jump links from navigation to FAQ section, 'Was this helpful?' voting on answers, Contact CTA if question not answered, (6) Accessibility: Keyboard navigation (Enter to expand), ARIA labels for screen readers, Heading hierarchy for structure. Mobile-optimized with larger touch targets.
description: Creates efficient self-service support that reduces friction in the buying process. Well-designed FAQs can reduce support tickets by 30% and improve conversions by addressing objections. Essential for SaaS and e-commerce sites.

prompt:

use_case: Building a comparison table section for pricing or feature comparison
prompt: Design a clear, conversion-optimized comparison table for homepage inclusion. Table structure: (1) Layout: 3-4 columns comparing options (tiers, products, plans), Highlight recommended or most popular option with: Different background color, 'Most Popular' badge, Slightly larger size or border, (2) Row organization: Header row with plan names and pricing, 'Sign Up' CTA button in each column, Feature rows with checkmarks/x marks, Category separators for grouped features, (3) Visual elements: Icon indicators (✓ checkmark, ✗ cross, ~ partial), Color coding (green for yes, gray for no), Tooltips for complex features on hover, Collapsible sections for extensive features, (4) Responsive design: Horizontal scroll on mobile with sticky first column, Or: Stack columns vertically on mobile, Card-style layout for mobile, (5) Interactive features: Toggle between monthly/annual pricing, 'See all features' expansion link, Highlight differences between tiers. Ensure high contrast for readability. Include summary row at bottom. Make CTAs prominent in popular column.
description: Creates effective comparison tables that aid decision-making and increase conversions. Clear feature comparison can reduce sales cycle time by 40%. Essential for SaaS, e-commerce, and service-based businesses.

use_case: Creating a countdown timer section for launches or limited offers
prompt: Design an engaging countdown timer that creates urgency and drives action. Timer components: (1) Display format: Large numbers showing: Days, Hours, Minutes, Seconds, Labels below each unit, Use flip animation or smooth counting, (2) Visual design: Bold, large numbers (48-72px), High contrast colors, Background distinct from page (accent color or gradient), Optional circular progress rings around numbers, (3) Context: Headline explaining what's counting down ('Launch in', 'Offer ends in', 'Event starts in'), Subtext with date/time in words, CTA button below timer ('Notify Me', 'Reserve Spot'), (4) Functionality: Live JavaScript countdown, Time zone handling, Action when countdown reaches zero (reveal content, redirect, show message), Optional recurring countdown for regular sales, (5) Design variations: Inline timer in header bar, Full-section timer for major events, Floating timer badge. Save user's timezone preference. Include fallback for disabled JavaScript. Create urgency without being pushy.
description: Implements urgency tactics that can increase conversions by 20%+ through FOMO (fear of missing out). Countdown timers are effective for launches, sales, and event promotions. Based on conversion optimization research.

use_case: Optimizing CTAs for maximum click-through rates
prompt:
Design 10 high-converting CTA variations for [specific funnel stage] targeting [audience]. For each CTA provide:
- Button text (action-oriented, under 5 words)
- Supporting microcopy (value statement)
- Visual design suggestions (color, size, placement)
- Contextual triggers (when/where to show)
- A/B test hypothesis

Include CTAs for different user intent levels (high, medium, low) and different devices (desktop, mobile). Focus on reducing friction and increasing urgency. Provide psychological reasoning for each variation.
description: Generates diverse CTA options optimized for different scenarios and user psychology. Includes testing framework for continuous optimization. Best for improving conversion rates at critical decision points.

use_case: Setting up A/B testing framework for funnel optimization
prompt:
Create a comprehensive A/B testing strategy for [specific funnel element] with:

1. Hypothesis framework:
   - Current performance baseline: [metrics]
   - Proposed changes and rationale
   - Expected impact and minimum detectable effect

2. Test variations:
   - Control version description
   - 3-5 challenger variations with specific changes
   - Prioritization based on potential impact

3. Testing parameters:
   - Sample size calculation
   - Test duration and traffic allocation
   - Success metrics and statistical significance threshold

4. Implementation plan:
   - Technical setup requirements
   - Tool recommendations (free and paid)
   - Monitoring and iteration strategy

Provide code examples for implementation and analysis dashboards. Include common pitfalls to avoid.
description: Establishes a scientific testing framework for continuous funnel improvement. Includes statistical rigor and practical implementation guidance. Best for data-driven optimization of any funnel element.

use_case: Implementing urgency and scarcity tactics ethically
prompt:
Design ethical urgency and scarcity mechanisms for [offer/product] that increase conversions without manipulating users:

1. Time-based urgency:
   - Limited-time offer copy templates
   - Countdown timer implementations (code)
   - Deadline communication strategy

2. Quantity scarcity:
   - Stock level displays
   - Limited availability messaging
   - Waitlist strategies

3. Social proof urgency:
   - 'Others are viewing' notifications
   - Recent purchase popups
   - Trending product indicators

4. FOMO triggers:
   - Bonus expiration notices
   - Early-bird pricing tiers
   - Exclusive access frameworks

Ensure all tactics are genuine and transparent. Provide A/B testing framework to measure impact. Include psychological principles behind each tactic.
description: Creates urgency mechanisms that drive action while maintaining ethical standards. Balances persuasion with transparency. Can increase conversion rates by 15-30% when implemented correctly.

3. Mobile optimization:

use_case: Building a conversion-focused homepage with 1:1 attention ratio
prompt: Design a laser-focused homepage with a singular conversion goal and 1:1 attention ratio. Create a minimalist layout centered on one primary action (sign-up, purchase, or inquiry). Use ample white space (30%+ of layout) to direct focus. Ensure the CTA is above the fold and repeated once after key content. Mobile-optimized with sticky CTA.

Include option to switch to 'GUI mode' for broader accessibility. Reference: Terminal-style portfolio in Codecademy Lovable article.

3. Post-webinar sequence:

   - Application/booking emails
   - Scarcity and urgency messaging
   - Follow-up call scheduling

4. Technical setup:
   - Platform recommendations (Zoom, Demio, etc.)
   - Slide deck templates
   - Chat engagement strategies
   - Conversion tracking setup

Provide complete scripts, email sequences, and conversion optimization tactics. Target: 5-15% conversion to high-ticket offer.
description: Creates comprehensive webinar funnel for selling premium offers. Includes all touchpoints from registration to sale. Effective for building trust and demonstrating value before asking for significant commitment.

use_case: Creating micro-commitment funnel for complex products
prompt:
Design a micro-commitment funnel for [complex/high-consideration product] that builds trust gradually:

   - Level 2: Lead magnet download (email capture)
   - Level 3: Tool/calculator usage (engagement)
   - Level 4: Quiz/assessment completion (qualification)
   - Level 5: Free trial/demo signup
   - Level 6: Purchase decision

2. Psychology:
   - Consistency principle application
   - Progressive profiling strategy
   - Value delivery at each step
   - Trust-building sequence

3. Content for each stage:
   - Educational assets
   - Interactive tools
   - Case studies and proof
   - Trial/demo materials

4. Automation:
   - Behavioral email triggers
   - Scoring and segmentation
   - Sales-ready notification system
   - Nurture paths for non-advancing leads

Provide complete funnel map, content outlines, and automation rules. Target: 60%+ progression through stages.
description: Reduces resistance to high-commitment decisions through series of smaller commitments. Particularly effective for complex, expensive, or unfamiliar products. Increases final conversion by 40-60%.

use_case: Creating video funnel with interactive elements
prompt:
Design a video-centric sales funnel with interactive elements:

   - Clickable CTAs within videos
   - Branching video paths based on choices
   - Lead capture forms at key moments
   - Quizzes and assessments in video

3. Personalization:
   - Dynamic video content based on viewer data
   - Personalized thumbnails and titles
   - Customized video messaging
   - Automated video follow-ups

4. Technical implementation:
   - Interactive video platform selection (Wistia, Vidyard)
   - Hosting and delivery optimization
   - Analytics and engagement tracking
   - Integration with email and CRM

Provide video scripts, interactive element suggestions, and technical setup guide. Target: 2-3x engagement vs static content.
description: Leverages video's high engagement rates with interactive conversion elements. Videos can increase conversion by 80%+ when interactive elements are added. Ideal for visual products and complex explanations.

use_case: Building omnichannel funnel with consistent experience
prompt:
Design an omnichannel sales funnel with seamless experience across platforms:

   - Website/landing pages

   - Social media (Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn)

   - Offline touchpoints

2. Consistency framework:
   - Unified messaging and brand voice

3. Customer journey mapping:
   - Entry points for each channel
   - Cross-channel progression paths

4. Technical integration:
   - CDP (Customer Data Platform) selection

   - Unified analytics
   - Marketing automation workflows

Provide channel-specific strategies, integration architecture, and customer journey maps. Target: 30%+ higher conversion for omnichannel customers.
description: Creates seamless experience across all customer touchpoints. Omnichannel customers typically have 30% higher lifetime value. Essential for modern marketing in multi-device world.

use_case: Optimizing for accessibility and inclusive design
prompt:
Audit and optimize my sales funnel for accessibility and inclusion:

1. Technical accessibility:
   - WCAG 2.1 AA compliance

   - Keyboard navigation
   - Color contrast requirements

2. Content accessibility:
   - Alt text for images
   - Video captions and transcripts
   - Clear and simple language
   - Semantic HTML structure

3. Form accessibility:
   - Clear labels and instructions
   - Error message clarity
   - Fieldset and legend use
   - Progressive enhancement

4. Testing and validation:
   - Automated accessibility testing tools
   - Manual testing with assistive technologies
   - User testing with disabled users
   - Ongoing monitoring and improvement

Provide accessibility audit checklist, remediation guide, and implementation code. Include legal compliance considerations (ADA, Section 508).
description: Ensures funnel is usable by people with disabilities, expanding addressable market by 15-20%. Also improves overall UX for all users. Reduces legal risk and demonstrates social responsibility.

use_case: Preventing unintended changes during iterative development
prompt: Only make the exact changes I request—do not modify, remove, or alter any other code, styling, or page elements unless explicitly instructed.
description: Guardrail prompt that ensures AI makes only requested changes. Use this as a constraint in all prompts to maintain control and prevent AI drift. Add this to every prompt when making specific changes.

prompt:
You are a senior [language] developer focused on clean, maintainable code. Follow these principles:
- SOLID design patterns
- DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself)
- Clear naming conventions
- Comprehensive error handling
- Write code as if it will be reviewed

Apply these to all code you generate.

use_case: Building viral referral loop into existing funnel
prompt:
Design a referral program for [product/service] that creates viral growth:

2. Mechanics:

   - Easy sharing options (email, social, SMS)

   - Automated reward fulfillment

3. Promotional strategy:

   - Post-purchase referral requests
   - Gamification elements (leaderboards, badges)

4. Technical implementation:

   - Dashboard for users to track referrals
   - Integration with existing funnel
   - Anti-fraud measures

Provide code examples, promotional copy templates, and viral coefficient calculations. Target: 1.5+ viral coefficient (each user brings 1.5 new users).
description: Creates self-perpetuating growth engine through customer referrals. Reduces customer acquisition costs while increasing trust through word-of-mouth. Can contribute 20-40% of new customer acquisition.

use_case: Creating partner/affiliate funnel for channel expansion

Design a partner/affiliate program funnel that scales lead generation:

Provide partner recruitment materials, commission calculator, and program documentation. Target: 20-30% of revenue from partner channel.

use_case: Designing a high-converting hero section with optimal above-the-fold content
prompt: Create a hero section optimized for maximum impact and conversions, visible above the 1080px fold. Structure: (1) Headline: 8-12 words addressing the main user benefit, using power words and emotional triggers, 40-48px font size, (2) Subheadline: 15-25 words elaborating on the value proposition, addressing pain points, (3) Primary CTA: High-contrast button with action-oriented text ('Get Started Free', 'See It In Action'), positioned in F-pattern hot spot, 48-56px height for easy clicking, (4) Hero visual: High-quality image/video showing product in use or aspirational outcome, positioned on right side (Z-pattern) or as background, (5) Trust indicators: Display 'As seen in' logos, customer count ('Join 50,000+ users'), or 5-star rating, (6) Secondary CTA or social proof: Subtle 'Learn More' link or testimonial snippet. Ensure content is scannable in 3-5 seconds. A/B test CTA colors and copy.
description: Optimizes the most critical screen real estate for maximum conversion impact. Strong hero sections can increase sign-ups by 20-40%. Based on analysis of Apple, Mailchimp, and other conversion-optimized homepages.

use_case: Designing a restaurant/hospitality homepage with immersive atmosphere
prompt: Create an atmospheric, reservation-driving homepage for restaurants or hospitality businesses. Design approach: (1) Visual hero: Full-screen video of dining experience or signature dish preparation, Overlay text with restaurant name and tagline, 'Reserve a Table' CTA prominently displayed, Current availability indicator, (2) Menu preview: Featured dishes with professional food photography, Prices displayed, Dietary indicator icons (vegan, gluten-free), Link to full menu PDF, (3) Atmosphere section: Gallery of interior and ambiance photos, Virtual tour option, Instagram feed integration, (4) Reservation system: Integrated booking widget (OpenTable, Resy), Time slot availability, Party size selector, Special occasion notes option, (5) Location & hours: Embedded map, Hours of operation, Parking information, Contact details, (6) Chef/story section: About the chef/establishment, Culinary philosophy, Awards and recognition. Use warm, appetizing color palette. Ensure mobile booking is seamless. Reference: Sirenis Hotels & Resorts (CSS Design Award winner).
description: Creates immersive hospitality homepages that drive reservations and convey atmosphere. High-quality visuals and seamless booking increase online reservations by 30%+. Based on award-winning hospitality sites like Sirenis Hotels.

use_case: Building an interactive product configurator or customizer on homepage
prompt: Design an engaging product configurator that lets users customize products visually. Configurator components: (1) Product preview: Large, high-quality image of product, Live preview updating with selections, 360-degree view capability, Zoom functionality, Multiple angle views, (2) Configuration options: Categories of options (Color, Size, Material, Features), Visual selectors (color swatches, image thumbnails), Dropdown or radio buttons for text options, Option descriptions and upcharges, Dependency handling (some options affect others), (3) Pricing display: Base price clearly shown, Live price updates with selections, Subtotal and option breakdowns, Save/favorite configuration option, (4) User flow: Logical progression through options, Progress indicator for complex configurators, Summary of selections, 'Add to Cart' or 'Get Quote' CTA, Option to save/share configuration, (5) Mobile optimization: Swipe between product images, Collapsible option sections, Fixed footer with price and CTA. Save configuration to URL for sharing. Provide default/popular configurations as starting points. Include reset button.
description: Creates powerful product customization experiences that increase engagement and average order value by 20%+. Interactive configurators reduce decision paralysis and increase confidence in purchases. Popular in furniture, fashion, and tech e-commerce.

use_case: Designing an interactive hero section with micro-animations and scroll effects
prompt: Create an immersive, award-winning hero section with sophisticated animations and scroll-triggered effects. Implementation: (1) Parallax scrolling background with foreground content moving at different speeds (z-axis depth), (2) Fade-in animations for headline and CTA on page load (0.5s delay with ease-out), (3) Micro-interactions on hover: CTA button with scale transform (1.05x) and shadow depth increase, (4) Scroll-triggered reveals: Elements fade in with upward slide animation as user scrolls (use Intersection Observer API), (5) Subtle floating animation for hero image or illustrations, (6) Mouse-tracking spotlight effect that follows cursor, (7) Smooth scroll for anchor links with offset, (8) Video background (muted autoplay) or animated gradient background. Ensure all animations respect prefers-reduced-motion for accessibility. Optimize performance: use CSS transforms (not position) and will-change property sparingly.
description: Implements cutting-edge animation techniques seen in Awwwards Site of the Day winners. Creates engaging, delightful user experiences while maintaining performance. Animations should enhance, not overwhelm, with respect for accessibility preferences.

use_case: Implementing a full-screen video background homepage with overlay content
prompt: Design a cinematic homepage featuring full-screen video background with content overlay. Technical implementation: (1) Video specifications: MP4 format for broad compatibility, 1920x1080 minimum resolution, 30-60 seconds loop, Muted autoplay on page load, Fallback image for mobile or slow connections, (2) Video optimization: Compress to under 5MB for fast loading, Lazy load video after critical content, Use poster attribute for instant display, (3) Content overlay: Semi-transparent dark overlay (rgba(0,0,0,0.5)) for text readability, White text for maximum contrast, Centered content: headline, subheadline, CTA, Minimal text to avoid competing with video, (4) Controls: Pause/play button in corner, Mute/unmute toggle, Skip to content anchor link, (5) Accessibility: Provide text alternative for video content, Ensure video doesn't trigger motion sickness (avoid rapid movement), Test with prefers-reduced-motion preference. Use cases: Brand storytelling, Product demonstrations, Lifestyle branding, Event promotion.
description: Creates dramatic, engaging homepage experiences with full-screen video. Video backgrounds can increase engagement by 80% when properly optimized. Common in Awwwards winners, requires careful performance optimization.

use_case: Designing a homepage with 3D elements and immersive graphics
prompt: Create a cutting-edge homepage featuring 3D graphics and interactive elements. 3D implementation: (1) Hero 3D element: 3D product model that rotates on mouse movement, Three.js or similar WebGL library, Smooth camera movements, Option to click and drag for manual rotation, (2) 3D illustrations: Floating isometric illustrations, Layered depth creating parallax effect, Shadows and lighting for realism, (3) Interactive scenes: Elements that respond to scroll position, Morphing 3D shapes, Particles or confetti effects on interactions, (4) Performance optimization: Lazy load 3D assets after page load, Reduced 3D complexity on mobile devices, Fallback to 2D images if WebGL unavailable, (5) Integration with content: 3D elements complement, not overwhelm content, Text overlays on 3D backgrounds remain readable, Smooth integration between 3D and flat sections. Use Spline, Three.js, or React Three Fiber for implementation. Ensure 3D doesn't block main content. Test performance across devices. Reference: Gallery of Emerging Species (Awwwards winner) for inspiration.
description: Implements cutting-edge 3D design seen in 2025 award-winning sites. 3D elements create memorable experiences and demonstrate technical sophistication. Increases engagement but requires careful performance optimization.

use_case: Creating a homepage with cursor-following interactive elements
prompt: Design subtle, sophisticated cursor-following effects that enhance interactivity. Interactive cursor elements: (1) Custom cursor design: Replace default cursor with custom design, Scale changes on hover over interactive elements, Color changes based on element hovered, Smooth follow animation (use transform, not position), (2) Cursor follower elements: Circular element that follows cursor with delay, Size: 20-40px diameter, Opacity: 20-40% for subtlety, Blends with page content, Grows on hover over clickable elements, (3) Magnetic effects: Elements that slightly move toward cursor on hover, Buttons with magnetic pull effect (within 100px radius), Smooth animation using lerp (linear interpolation), (4) Spotlight effect: Circular highlight that follows cursor, Darkens rest of page slightly, Useful for image reveals or emphasis, Toggle on/off with button, (5) Implementation: Use requestAnimationFrame for smooth performance, Track mouse position with event listeners, Apply transforms for smooth animations, Disable on mobile (touch devices), Respect prefers-reduced-motion. Keep effects subtle - enhance, don't distract. Test performance impact. Ensure site is fully usable without effects.
description: Implements sophisticated cursor interactions seen in award-winning portfolio sites. Custom cursors create unique brand experiences and demonstrate technical prowess. Popular in creative agency and designer portfolios.

use_case: Creating a homepage with horizontal scrolling sections or galleries
prompt: Design an engaging homepage with horizontal scrolling sections that create unique navigation experiences. Horizontal scroll implementation: (1) Section structure: Container with overflow-x: scroll or auto, Content wider than viewport, Flex or grid layout for items, Smooth scrolling behavior enabled, Snap points for item alignment (CSS scroll-snap), (2) Use cases: Project/portfolio gallery, Product showcase carousel, Timeline visualization, Feature comparison, Testimonial slider, Image galleries, (3) User experience: Scroll indicators (arrows, dots, or progress bar), Mouse wheel hijacking for horizontal scroll (optional), Drag to scroll functionality, Keyboard navigation (arrow keys), Touch/swipe gestures on mobile, 'Scroll to explore' indicator, (4) Visual design: Items with consistent sizing or varied for interest, Spacing between items (24-40px), Fade-out edges to indicate more content, Center-focused design (highlight middle item), Momentum scrolling for natural feel, (5) Responsive behavior: Maintain horizontal scroll on tablet, Convert to vertical stack on mobile, Or: Reduce items per view on smaller screens. Ensure keyboard accessibility. Provide alternative navigation for users who prefer it. Don't overuse - one horizontal section per page maximum.
description: Creates distinctive horizontal scrolling experiences that break traditional vertical flow. Horizontal sections add visual interest and are particularly effective for galleries and timelines. Popular in Awwwards winners like Nomadic Tribe.

use_case: Creating a language/region selector for international homepages
prompt: Design an intuitive language and region selection interface for global sites. Selector components: (1) Trigger placement: Globe icon in header/footer, Flag icons showing current language, Text link ('EN | 中文 | ES'), Footer position common, (2) Selection modal: List of available languages, Region/country selection if relevant, Search/filter for long lists, Show language in native script (español, not Spanish), Flag icons for visual recognition, (3) User experience: Remember user's choice (cookie/localStorage), Redirect to appropriate language version, Preserve user's current page (switch language, not page), Show warning if content not available in chosen language, Option to auto-detect language from browser, (4) Design: Clean, simple modal or dropdown, Organized by regions if many languages, Current language highlighted, Hover/focus states, (5) Mobile optimization: Bottom sheet modal on mobile, Larger touch targets, Grouped by region for easier scanning. Update URL to reflect language (/en/, /es/). Include RTL support for Arabic, Hebrew. Test translations thoroughly. Default to browser language when possible.
description: Implements effective internationalization that expands global reach. Proper language selection can increase international conversions by 30%+. Essential for global businesses and SaaS platforms serving multiple markets.

use_case: Creating landing page copy that converts cold traffic

Write conversion-optimized landing page copy for [product/service] targeting [audience] with [specific pain point]. Structure:

2. Subheadline: Clarify the transformation
3. Hero section: Emotional hook and credibility
4. Problem agitation: 3-5 specific pain points
5. Solution presentation: How you solve it uniquely
6. Features & benefits: 5-7 key points
7. Social proof: Testimonial framework
8. Risk reversal: Guarantee language
9. CTA: Primary and secondary calls-to-action
10. Urgency/scarcity elements

Use conversational tone, power words, and ensure mobile-readability. Include A/B testing suggestions for key elements.
description: Generates complete landing page copy following proven conversion frameworks. Incorporates psychological triggers and persuasion principles. Ideal for PPC campaigns, product launches, and lead generation pages.

use_case: Building a complete landing page from scratch

use_case: Designing an irresistible lead magnet for top-of-funnel lead capture
prompt:

use_case: Developing interactive quiz funnel for product recommendations

use_case: Implementing chatbot for automated lead qualification

use_case: Implementing progressive profiling in multi-step forms
prompt:

   - Stage 2: Qualification data (company, role)
   - Stage 3: Preference data (interests, goals)
   - Stage 4: Behavioral data (actions, engagement)

2. Form optimization:

Provide form structures, field prioritization, and code examples. Target: 40%+ higher completion rates than single-step forms.

use_case: Building an email newsletter signup section with lead magnet offer
prompt: Design a high-converting email signup section that builds your subscriber list. Signup components: (1) Value proposition: Compelling headline (e.g., 'Get Weekly Design Tips'), Specific benefits of subscribing (list 2-3 bullets), Frequency promise ('Every Tuesday', 'Weekly', 'No spam ever'), (2) Lead magnet: Free resource offer (ebook, template, guide, checklist), Visual thumbnail of the resource, Clear title and description, Immediate delivery promise ('Instant access'), (3) Form design: Email input field only (reduce friction), Optional name field, Large, prominent 'Subscribe' button, Action-oriented button text ('Get My Free Guide'), Privacy assurance ('We respect your privacy'), (4) Visual elements: Relevant illustration or image, Background color to distinguish section, Icon of email or newsletter, (5) Post-signup: Thank you message, Confirmation email requirement notification, Social media follow options. Integrate with email service (Mailchimp, ConvertKit). Include GDPR-compliant checkbox if required. A/B test different lead magnets.
description: Creates effective email capture that can increase signup rates by 50%+ with compelling lead magnets. Email list building is crucial for long-term marketing success. Lead magnets increase perceived value exchange.

prompt:
Add cookie consent banner:
- GDPR/CCPA compliant
- Granular cookie preferences
- Remember user choice
- Block non-essential cookies until consent
- Link to privacy policy
- Accessible and non-intrusive

Use cookie consent library or build custom.
description: Privacy-compliant cookie banner. Check local regulations for specific requirements.

use_case: Creating a cookie consent banner with GDPR compliance
prompt: Design a user-friendly cookie consent banner that meets legal requirements. Banner components: (1) Placement options: Bottom banner (most common), Top banner, Modal overlay (for first visit), Corner popup, (2) Content: Clear headline ('We use cookies'), Brief explanation of cookie usage (1-2 sentences), Link to full Privacy Policy, Link to Cookie Policy, (3) Action buttons: 'Accept All' button (prominent, primary color), 'Reject All' or 'Necessary Only' option, 'Customize' or 'Manage Preferences' button, (4) Preferences modal (if customizable): Cookie categories: Necessary (always on), Analytics, Marketing, Personalization, Toggle switches for each category, Description of each category's purpose, Save preferences button, (5) Technical implementation: Set consent cookie on choice, Respect user's choice, Remember choice for X days/months, Load tracking scripts only after consent, Re-show banner if consent expires. Design should not obstruct critical content. Make consent genuine, not coercive. Include reject option equal to accept. Test across devices.
description: Implements legally compliant cookie consent meeting GDPR and privacy requirements. Proper implementation protects from legal issues and builds user trust. Essential for sites serving EU visitors and increasingly important globally.

prompt:

1. Any ambiguous requirements
2. Missing information
3. Potential edge cases not covered
4. Suggestions for making it more concise and precise

Then rewrite the prompt with improvements.

prompt:

description: Reverse meta prompting that documents solutions and creates reusable prompts. Builds a knowledge base of working solutions.

prompt:
Optimize my sales funnel for mobile users visiting from [traffic source]. Address:

1. Mobile UX improvements:
   - Touch-friendly navigation and buttons (minimum 44x44px)
   - Simplified forms with smart defaults
   - Progressive disclosure for complex information
   - Thumb-zone optimized layouts

2. Page speed optimization:
   - Image compression and lazy loading strategies
   - Critical CSS and above-the-fold optimization
   - Minimize HTTP requests

3. Mobile-specific content:
   - Scannable copy with short paragraphs
   - Click-to-call and map integration
   - Mobile-optimized CTAs

4. Technical implementation:
   - Responsive design breakpoints
   - Mobile-first CSS framework
   - Performance testing checklist

Provide code snippets and mobile preview mockups. Target: <3 second load time, >50% mobile conversion rate.
description: Creates a mobile-optimized funnel that converts effectively on smaller screens. Addresses technical and UX considerations for mobile users. Critical as mobile traffic often exceeds 60% of total visitors.

use_case: Building an intuitive navigation system with modern information architecture
prompt: Design a comprehensive navigation system that balances simplicity with depth of content. Components: (1) Primary navigation: Horizontal menu with 5-7 main items, mega-menu dropdowns for complex hierarchies showing visual previews, (2) Mobile navigation: Hamburger menu that expands to full-screen overlay with large touch targets, (3) Sticky header that condenses on scroll, (4) Breadcrumbs for deep pages showing user location, (5) Search functionality with autocomplete, (6) Secondary footer navigation with sitemap structure, (7) Visual indicators for current page (active state highlighting). Organize content using card sorting principles: group related items, use clear labels (not clever/vague wording), limit dropdown depth to 2 levels maximum. Include icons beside navigation labels for visual recognition. Ensure keyboard navigation support (Tab key) and ARIA labels for screen readers.
description: Creates intuitive navigation following NN/G usability guidelines. Good navigation reduces bounce rates by up to 40% and helps users quickly find content. Based on patterns from CSS Design Award winners emphasizing usability and user flow.

use_case: Creating a mega-menu navigation for complex site hierarchies
prompt: Design a sophisticated mega-menu that handles deep site hierarchies elegantly. Mega-menu structure: (1) Trigger: Hover or click on main nav item to reveal, Smooth dropdown animation (fade + slide down), Backdrop overlay dimming page content, (2) Menu layout: Full-width dropdown panel (or section-width), Multi-column grid layout (3-5 columns), Column categories with bold headers, Link lists under each category, Visual separator between columns, (3) Enhanced features: Thumbnail images for featured items, Icons beside links for visual recognition, Featured content card highlighting popular pages, 'View All' links at column bottoms, Recent or trending items section, (4) Design elements: Subtle background color difference, Consistent padding and spacing, Hover states on individual links, Smooth transitions on menu close, (5) Mobile adaptation: Convert to accordion-style menu, Category headers expandable, Nested levels revealed on tap. Ensure keyboard navigation works (Tab through links). Include close button in mobile version. Limit depth to 2-3 levels maximum for usability.
description: Creates powerful navigation for content-rich sites with many pages. Mega-menus improve discoverability and reduce clicks to content by 30%. Essential for large e-commerce sites, universities, and content portals.

use_case: Designing a homepage footer with comprehensive navigation and information
prompt: Create a feature-rich footer that serves as a sitemap and information hub. Footer structure: (1) Multi-column layout: 4-5 columns on desktop, Stack vertically on mobile, Column headers (bold, slightly larger), Link lists under each header (8-12 links max per column), (2) Column categories: Products/Services, Company (About, Careers, Press), Support (FAQ, Contact, Help), Legal (Privacy, Terms, Cookies), Resources (Blog, Guides, Case Studies), (3) Footer top section: Newsletter signup form, Social media icon links, Award badges or certifications, Trust signals or payment icons, (4) Footer bottom: Copyright notice, Business registration details, Language/region selector, Back to top button, (5) Visual design: Distinct background color (darker than body), Ample padding (60-80px top/bottom), Subtle divider line above footer, Consistent link styling with hover effects, (6) Additional elements: Contact information, Business hours, Map or location, Mobile app download buttons. Ensure all links are accessible and functional. Footer should be scannable and organized. Include sitemap link for SEO.
description: Creates comprehensive footers that improve navigation and SEO. Well-organized footers help users find information and can reduce support requests by 15%. Essential for larger sites with extensive page hierarchies.

use_case: Designing a one-page scrolling website with smooth section navigation
prompt: Create a single-page scrolling website with distinct sections and smooth navigation. Structure: (1) Fixed navigation: Sticky header with anchor links to sections, Active section indicator in nav (current section highlighted), Logo that scales down on scroll, (2) Section design: Full-height sections (100vh) for impact, Distinct visual theme for each section (colors, backgrounds), Smooth scroll behavior with CSS scroll-snap, Scroll progress indicator (top or side), (3) Section types: Hero/intro, About/mission, Services/features, Portfolio/work, Team, Testimonials, Contact/footer, (4) Transitions: Fade-in animations as sections enter viewport, Parallax backgrounds between sections, Section dividers (angled edges, waves, curves), (5) Navigation aids: 'Scroll to explore' indicator on hero, Floating 'Back to top' button, Section pagination dots on side, Keyboard navigation support (arrow keys). Optimize for mobile with shorter sections. Ensure all content is accessible via keyboard Tab navigation.
description: Creates seamless one-page experiences that keep users engaged through smooth scrolling. Single-page sites reduce bounce rates and create cohesive narratives. Popular format for portfolios and small business sites.

use_case: Creating a sticky header that transforms on scroll with smart behavior
prompt: Design an intelligent sticky header that adapts as users scroll for optimal UX. Header behavior: (1) Initial state (top of page): Full-height header (80-100px), Large logo, Full navigation menu, Optional tagline or contact info, Background transparent or subtle, (2) Scrolled state: Condenses to 60-70px height, Logo scales down by 20-30%, Background becomes solid or gains shadow, Hide secondary elements (tagline, social icons), Smooth transition animation (300ms), (3) Smart features: Hide header on scroll down (save screen space), Show header on scroll up (quick access), Threshold: trigger after 100px scroll, Breakpoint: different behavior on mobile, (4) Navigation updates: Active page indicator, Search icon/bar in header, CTA button remains prominent, Mobile hamburger menu, (5) Additional elements: Progress bar showing page scroll position, Skip to content link for accessibility. Implement using Intersection Observer API or scroll event. Ensure no layout shift when header changes. Test on different scroll speeds.
description: Implements smart sticky navigation that improves UX by staying accessible while maximizing screen space. Smart headers reduce navigation time by 50% and improve mobile experience. Common pattern in award-winning responsive designs.

prompt:
Optimize this component for performance:
[paste code]

Apply these techniques:
- Implement React.memo or useMemo where appropriate
- Reduce unnecessary re-renders
- Lazy load images and components
- Code split large bundles

Explain the performance impact of each change.
description: Performance optimization prompt for React components. Use when components are slow or cause unnecessary re-renders.

prompt:
Implement lazy loading:
- Lazy load images below fold
- Skeleton loaders for content
- Infinite scroll implementation
- Code splitting for routes
- Dynamic imports for heavy components
- Prefetch on hover

Measure performance improvements.
description: Comprehensive lazy loading strategy. Use Intersection Observer API for efficient implementation.

use_case: Optimizing homepage for maximum performance and loading speed
prompt: Create a performance-optimized homepage that loads in under 2 seconds. Implementation checklist: (1) Image optimization: Use WebP format with fallbacks, implement lazy loading for below-fold images, use responsive images with srcset for different screen sizes, compress images to under 100KB each, (2) Code optimization: Minimize CSS/JS files, remove unused code, defer non-critical JavaScript, inline critical CSS, (3) Font loading: Use font-display: swap, subset fonts to include only used characters, limit to 2 font families, (4) Reduce HTTP requests: Combine files where possible, use CSS sprites for small icons, (5) Enable compression (Gzip/Brotli), (6) Implement browser caching with appropriate cache headers, (7) Use CDN for static assets, (8) Optimize Core Web Vitals: LCP under 2.5s, FID under 100ms, CLS under 0.1. Monitor with Lighthouse and PageSpeed Insights.
description: Implements comprehensive performance optimization strategies. Sites loading in under 3 seconds retain 70% more users. Fast loading is crucial for Awwwards recognition and user satisfaction. Based on Core Web Vitals and modern performance best practices.

use_case: Designing a loading screen with branded animation and progress indicator
prompt: Create an engaging loading screen that entertains users during page load. Loading design: (1) Loading animation: Branded spinner or logo animation, Smooth, looping animation, Represents brand personality (playful, professional, etc.), Use CSS animations or Lottie files, (2) Progress indication: Percentage counter (0-100%), Loading bar with smooth fill, Estimated time remaining (if calculable), Loading stage messages ('Loading assets...', 'Almost there...'), (3) Content priority: Show skeleton screens for main content, Progressive loading (show content as it loads), Fade out loading screen when ready, Don't block interaction if some content is ready, (4) Design elements: Background color matching site theme, Centered animation, Optional tagline or message, (5) Technical implementation: Lazy load non-critical assets, Preload critical resources, Set maximum loading time (5 seconds), Fallback for slow connections. Avoid splash screens on fast loads (show content immediately). Use loading screen only when necessary (initial load, large content). Test loading experience on slow connections.
description: Creates branded loading experiences that reduce perceived wait time and maintain engagement. Well-designed loaders improve user patience and brand recall. Should complement overall performance optimization strategy.

use_case: Implementing AI-powered personalization across funnel stages
prompt:
Create a hyper-personalization strategy for my sales funnel that:
- Segments users based on [behavioral data/demographics/psychographics]
- Delivers dynamic content based on user intent signals
- Implements predictive analytics for user behavior
- Personalizes email sequences and web experiences
- Uses real-time data to adjust offers and messaging

Provide specific AI tools for each personalization tactic, implementation steps, and expected conversion rate improvements. Target audience: [describe audience].
description: Develops a comprehensive personalization framework using AI. Increases conversion rates by 20-50% through targeted experiences. Best combined with CRM integration and behavioral tracking tools.

use_case: Optimizing funnel for different traffic temperatures
prompt:
Create customized funnel experiences for different audience temperatures:

1. Cold traffic (unaware):
   - Educational content-first approach
   - Longer nurture sequences
   - Low-commitment first offers
   - Trust-building emphasis

2. Warm traffic (problem-aware):
   - Solution-focused messaging
   - Comparison and alternatives content
   - Social proof prominence
   - Mid-level engagement asks

3. Hot traffic (solution-aware):
   - Direct offer presentation
   - Strong CTAs and urgency
   - Streamlined path to purchase
   - Immediate value demonstration

4. Implementation:
   - URL parameter tracking for source
   - Dynamic content based on referrer
   - Segmented email sequences
   - Ad creative variations

For each temperature, provide: Landing page structure, headline formulas, offer positioning, and expected conversion rates. Include code for dynamic content switching.
description: Matches funnel experience to visitor awareness level for maximum relevance. Dramatically improves conversion rates by meeting users where they are. Essential for multi-channel marketing campaigns.

prompt:
Create personality-based funnel variations for different buyer types:

1. Personality frameworks:
   - DISC profiles (Dominant, Influential, Steady, Conscientious)
   - Myers-Briggs types
   - Customer temperaments
   - Decision-making styles

2. Funnel customization:

     * Data-heavy content
     * Detailed specifications
     * Comparison charts
     * ROI calculators
   
   - For emotional buyers:
     * Story-driven content
     * Social proof emphasis
     * Visual and experiential
     * Community and belonging
   
   - For action-oriented buyers:
     * Quick decision paths
     * Clear CTAs
     * Minimal steps
     * Results-focused messaging
   
   - For relationship buyers:
     * Human connection emphasis
     * Personalized communication
     * Support availability
     * Trust-building content

3. Identification methods:
   - Quiz or assessment
   - Behavioral inference from actions
   - Survey questions
   - Purchase history analysis

4. Implementation:
   - Dynamic content switching
   - Segmented email paths
   - Personalized landing pages
   - Sales script variations

Provide personality mapping guide, content variations, and identification quiz. Target: 25%+ conversion improvement through personalization.
description: Matches funnel experience to buyer personality for maximum resonance. Addresses how different people make decisions. Sophisticated personalization that can significantly improve conversion rates.

prompt:
Design a two-sided funnel for [marketplace/platform] balancing supply and demand:

1. Supply side (sellers/service providers):
   - Recruitment and onboarding
   - Quality standards and vetting
   - Incentive structure
   - Success enablement

2. Demand side (buyers/users):
   - Discovery and browsing experience

   - Purchase/booking flow
   - Repeat usage drivers

3. Balance mechanisms:

   - Supply/demand monitoring
   - Geographic expansion strategy
   - Quality control systems

4. Network effects:

Provide marketplace funnel architecture, chicken-and-egg solution strategies, and growth playbook. Include metrics for monitoring marketplace health.
description: Addresses unique challenges of two-sided marketplaces. Requires careful balancing of supply and demand. Successful marketplace funnels create powerful network effects and sustainable competitive advantages.

use_case: Designing a portfolio homepage with creative project showcase
prompt: Create a stunning portfolio homepage that showcases creative work in an award-worthy presentation. Portfolio structure: (1) Hero introduction: Large name/brand as headline, Professional photo or logo, Concise positioning statement (one line), Animated tagline or role title, (2) Project grid: Masonry or equal-height grid layout, Hover effects revealing project titles and categories, Click-through to detailed case studies, Filter buttons by category/skill, (3) Project cards: High-quality cover images (3:2 or 16:9 ratio), Project title and client/company, Brief one-line description, Tech stack or tools used icons, (4) Case study previews: Before/after sliders, Featured metric or outcome, 'View Project' CTA, (5) About section: Personal photo, Expertise areas, Contact CTA. Include a downloadable resume/CV. Add smooth page transitions. Reference award winners: David Langarica's portfolio, Unseen Studio, Curious & Company websites for inspiration.
description: Creates professional portfolio homepages that win design awards and attract clients. Portfolio design should showcase both work quality and design skills. Based on Awwwards-winning portfolio sites with innovative presentations.

use_case: Designing a feature announcement banner for new products or updates
prompt: Create an attention-grabbing announcement banner for homepage promotions. Banner design: (1) Placement: Top of page above header, Slide-in from top on page load, Optional dismissible close button, (2) Content: Concise announcement (10-15 words max), Use urgency ('Limited Time', 'New', 'Just Launched'), Action-oriented ('Learn More', 'Try Now'), Optional countdown timer, (3) Visual design: Background color contrasting with site (not matching), Icon or emoji for visual interest, Bold, readable typography, Subtle animation (slide, pulse), (4) User experience: Don't show on every page visit (use cookies), Auto-hide after X seconds with smooth exit, Reappear after X days if dismissed, Link to relevant landing page, (5) Mobile optimization: Shorter text for mobile, Collapsible on mobile, Sticky positioning option. Track click-through rates. A/B test different messages. Don't overuse - reserve for important announcements. Ensure banner doesn't significantly increase page height on mobile.
description: Creates effective announcement banners that can increase promotion awareness by 60%+ and drive traffic to new features. Temporary banners create urgency and highlight important updates without permanent site changes.

prompt:
Refactor this [language] code to improve readability and maintainability:
[paste code]

Apply these improvements:
- Extract repeated logic into functions
- Add clear variable names
- Include JSDoc comments
- Follow [style guide] conventions

Explain each change you make.
description: Structured refactoring prompt that improves code quality while maintaining functionality. Use when cleaning up code or preparing for code reviews.

use_case: Creating crisis management funnel for reputation recovery
prompt:
Design a crisis response funnel for reputation management and customer recovery:

1. Crisis identification:
   - Monitoring systems for negative sentiment
   - Trigger thresholds for activation
   - Crisis categorization (severity levels)
   - Response team and protocols

2. Immediate response:
   - Acknowledgment messaging
   - Transparency and honesty approach
   - Action plan communication
   - Channel selection and coordination

3. Recovery funnel:
   - Affected customer identification
   - Personalized outreach and compensation
   - Trust rebuilding content
   - Positive story amplification

4. Prevention systems:
   - Regular reputation monitoring
   - Proactive issue resolution
   - Customer satisfaction improvements
   - Crisis simulation and preparation

Provide crisis response playbook, message templates, and monitoring dashboard. Include case studies of successful crisis management.
description: Prepares for and responds to reputation crises that can damage funnel performance. Quick, transparent response can minimize damage and even strengthen brand. Essential insurance policy for digital businesses.

use_case: Designing a mobile-first responsive homepage with optimal touch targets
prompt: Create a fully responsive, mobile-first homepage that adapts seamlessly across all breakpoints. Design specifications: (1) Mobile layout (320px-767px): Single column, 44px minimum touch target size, thumb-zone optimized navigation, sticky header with hamburger menu, (2) Tablet layout (768px-1023px): Two-column grid with flexible images, (3) Desktop layout (1024px+): Multi-column with max-width container. Implement: Front-loaded key navigation elements, simplified mobile typography (16px body minimum for readability), optimized images with lazy loading, reduced animations on mobile for performance, easily tappable CTAs with adequate spacing (minimum 8px between elements). Use CSS Grid and Flexbox for fluid responsiveness. Test at breakpoints: 375px, 768px, 1024px, 1440px. Prioritize core web vitals: LCP under 2.5s, FID under 100ms.
description: Implements mobile-first design principles that can increase mobile transactions by 29% (Cocohanee case study). Follows Awwwards Mobile Excellence criteria requiring 70%+ mobile usability scores and ensures accessibility across all devices.

prompt:
Make this design mobile-responsive using Tailwind CSS breakpoints:
- Mobile (< 640px): Stack elements vertically
- Tablet (640px - 1024px): 2-column grid
- Desktop (> 1024px): 3-column grid

Ensure touch targets are at least 44px. Test with Chrome DevTools.
description: Mobile-first responsive design prompt with specific breakpoints. Include accessibility requirements like minimum touch target sizes.

use_case: Creating retargeting campaign for funnel drop-offs
prompt:
Design a multi-channel retargeting strategy for users who dropped off at [funnel stage]. Include:

1. Segmentation:
   - Define audience segments based on behavior
   - Create custom audiences for each drop-off point
   - Prioritize by likelihood to convert

2. Campaign structure:
   - Facebook/Instagram ad sequences (3-5 ads)
   - Google Display Network remarketing
   - Email win-back campaigns
   - SMS retargeting (if applicable)

3. Creative strategy:
   - Ad copy addressing specific objections
   - Visual concepts and formats
   - Offer/incentive recommendations
   - Frequency and timing guidelines

4. Technical setup:
   - Pixel implementation code
   - Audience creation steps
   - Budget allocation recommendations
   - Success metrics and optimization triggers

Provide campaign examples for 3 different drop-off scenarios. Include cost projections and ROI targets.
description: Creates targeted campaigns to recover lost prospects at various funnel stages. Addresses specific objections and provides incentives for return. Can recover 15-30% of abandoned conversions.

use_case: Building community-driven funnel for brand loyalty
prompt:
Design a community-centric funnel that builds brand loyalty and reduces churn:

1. Community structure:

3. Platform strategy:

   - Content calendar for community
   - Success metrics and KPIs

4. Monetization:

Provide community guidelines, engagement strategies, and funnel integration points. Target: 30%+ increase in customer lifetime value.
description: Creates engaged community that drives retention, referrals, and repeat purchases. Transforms customers into brand advocates. Reduces churn by 25-40% and increases LTV significantly.

prompt:
Add SEO optimization to this page:
- Dynamic meta tags (title, description, OG tags)
- Structured data for [type]
- Semantic HTML elements
- Alt text for all images
- Proper heading hierarchy (h1-h6)
- XML sitemap integration

Use Next.js metadata API or React Helmet.

prompt:
Create a sitemap generator:
- Generate XML sitemap of all pages
- Update automatically on content changes
- Include priority and change frequency
- Split large sitemaps
- Submit to search engines
- Generate robots.txt

use_case: Building a product-focused SaaS homepage with feature highlights
prompt: Design a conversion-optimized SaaS homepage that clearly communicates product value. Page structure: (1) Above-fold hero: Product screenshot or demo GIF showing key interface, Benefit-driven headline (not feature list), 'Start Free Trial' CTA with no credit card required message, Trusted by logos of recognized brands, (2) Feature sections: 3-4 key features with icons, titles, descriptions, Each feature with supporting visual (screenshot, diagram, or illustration), Alternating left-right layout for visual variety, (3) How it works: 3-step process with numbered steps, Simple illustrations or icons, Progression arrows connecting steps, (4) Social proof section: Customer testimonials with specific metrics, Star rating with review count, ROI calculator or savings estimator, (5) Pricing preview: Simple tier comparison (Starter, Pro, Enterprise), Highlight most popular tier, Link to full pricing page, (6) FAQ section: 5-8 common objections addressed, Accordion format to save space. Include live demo or product tour CTA.
description: Creates high-converting SaaS homepages following proven patterns from successful products. Clear product communication and social proof can increase trial sign-ups by 40%+. Based on analysis of top SaaS homepages.

use_case: Creating SaaS free trial funnel with activation focus

   - Trial length optimization (7, 14, or 30 days)
   - Feature access strategy (full vs limited)

use_case: Building a homepage with advanced search functionality and filters
prompt: Design a powerful search interface that helps users find content quickly. Search components: (1) Search input: Prominent search bar in header or hero section, Magnifying glass icon, Placeholder text ('Search products, articles...'), Click to expand (if space-constrained), Keyboard shortcut (Cmd+K or Ctrl+K), (2) Search features: Autocomplete suggestions as user types, Search history (recent searches), Popular/trending searches, Typo tolerance and fuzzy matching, Category filters (Articles, Products, Pages), (3) Results display: Search results page or modal overlay, Highlighted search terms in results, Result previews (title, excerpt, image), Filter/sort options on results page, Faceted search (filter by category, date, price), Results count ('54 results for 'design''), Pagination or infinite scroll, (4) Advanced search: Boolean operators support (AND, OR, NOT), Filter by date ranges, Price range sliders for e-commerce, Multi-select category filters, 'Save search' or alert option, (5) Mobile optimization: Full-screen search modal on mobile, Voice search option, Recent searches for easy access. Use search analytics to improve results. Implement search API (Algolia, Elasticsearch). Show 'no results' page with alternatives.
description: Implements powerful search that improves content discovery and user satisfaction. Good search can increase conversions by 50% on content-heavy or e-commerce sites. Essential for large catalogs and knowledge bases.

prompt:

prompt:

- Spam detection
- Moderate user-generated content
- Blocklist/allowlist words
- Report abuse mechanism
- Admin review queue

Use AI moderation API or rule-based.
