use_case: Integrating social proof and testimonials for credibility boost
prompt: Design a compelling social proof section that builds trust and drives conversions. Components: (1) Testimonial cards: Include authentic customer photo (not stock), full name and title/company, specific outcome or metric ('increased sales by 40%'), 3-4 lines of detailed feedback, 5-star rating displayed prominently, (2) Layout options: Carousel with auto-rotate (5s intervals) and manual controls, Masonry grid for varied testimonial lengths, Video testimonials with play buttons, (3) Strategic placement: Near primary CTA, after key features, in dedicated section mid-page, (4) Additional social proof: Customer logos in a separate 'Trusted by' section, Real-time notification popup ('John from NYC just signed up'), Total user count or satisfaction metric ('4.9/5 stars from 10,000+ reviews'), Case study preview cards with 'Read Full Story' links. 4. Case studies:
   - 3 detailed case study outlines
   - Measurable results and ROI focus

Provide implementation code snippets and design mockups for each element. Prioritize by impact on conversion rates.
description: Creates a multi-layered trust-building framework that addresses different trust barriers. Combines static and dynamic social proof for maximum credibility. Essential for increasing conversion rates across all funnel stages.

use_case: Building a homepage with variable fonts and dynamic typography
prompt: Design a homepage leveraging variable fonts for dynamic, responsive typography. Variable font implementation: (1) Font selection: Choose variable font (Google Fonts variable or custom), Verify browser support (90%+ as of 2025), Include fallback fonts, Common variable fonts: Inter, Roboto Flex, Source Sans Variable, (2) Variable axes: Weight (wght): 100-900, Width (wdth): 75-125, Optical size (opsz): 8-144, Custom axes depending on font, (3) Dynamic applications: Headings that adjust weight on viewport size, Text that responds to user interaction (hover weight change), Animated weight transitions for emphasis, Responsive optical sizing based on font size, Width adjustments for better fit on mobile, (4) Implementation: Use font-variation-settings CSS property, Animate with transitions or keyframes, Respond to viewport with CSS clamp() or media queries, Fine-tune tracking and line-height with variable fonts, (5) Performance benefits: Single font file instead of multiple weights, Reduce file size compared to traditional font families, Faster loading and better performance. Create unique typographic experiences. Test thoroughly across browsers. Balance creativity with readability. Demonstrate technical sophistication.
description: Implements cutting-edge variable font technology for dynamic, efficient typography. Variable fonts reduce load times while enabling creative effects. Shows technical expertise and aligns with modern performance optimization.

use_case: Optimizing typography for maximum readability and hierarchy
prompt: Create a typography system that ensures optimal readability and establishes clear hierarchy. Specifications: (1) Heading hierarchy: H1 (40-48px, bold, 1.2 line-height), H2 (32-36px), H3 (24-28px), H4 (20-22px), (2) Body text: 16-18px with 1.6-1.8 line-height for comfortable reading, (3) Font pairing: Combine serif headlines (Georgia, Playfair Display) with sans-serif body (Inter, Roboto) or vice versa, (4) Maximum line length: 60-75 characters for optimal readability, (5) Paragraph spacing: 1.5em between paragraphs, (6) Use font weights for emphasis: bold (700) for headings, medium (500) for subheadings, regular (400) for body, (7) Ensure mobile typography scales proportionally (reduce by 15-20% on mobile). Implement responsive typography using clamp() or fluid type scales. Maintain consistent rhythm with modular scale (1.25 or 1.333 ratio).
description: Creates accessible, readable typography systems that improve comprehension and user experience. Award-winning sites typically use 18-29px for headings with carefully calculated line heights. Based on typography best practices from top design awards.

use_case: Rapid UI prototyping with specific audience
prompt: Create a dashboard for a health tracking app for college students. Use colorful, modern colors and fonts. Include sections for daily steps, water intake, sleep hours, and mood tracking. Make it responsive and visually engaging.
description: High-level vibe prompt focusing on aesthetics and user experience. Best for initial prototypes where you want AI to make design decisions.

prompt: A cozy landing page for a mental health app. Inviting, soft colors (pastels), comforting tone. Include hero section with calming imagery, feature cards with icons, testimonials section, and gentle call-to-action. Typography should be easy to read.
description: Vibe design prompt focusing on emotional outcomes. Use when the feeling/atmosphere is more important than specific technical requirements.

prompt:
Generate a reusable UI component library with:
- Button variants (primary, secondary, outline, ghost)
- Input fields with validation states
- Cards with different layouts
- Modal/Dialog components
- Toast notifications
- Loading spinners and skeletons

Use Tailwind CSS or styled-components. Include TypeScript types.
description: Design system creation prompt. Build incrementally, starting with basic components before adding variants.

prompt:
Add dark mode support:
- CSS variables for colors
- Toggle switch in header
- Persist user preference in localStorage
- System preference detection
- Smooth transition between modes

Ensure all colors meet WCAG contrast ratios.
description: Dark mode with accessibility considerations. Specify color system (CSS variables, Tailwind dark mode, etc.).

prompt:
Create a carousel/slider component:
- Auto-play with pause on hover
- Navigation arrows and dots
- Touch/swipe support
- Lazy load images
- Accessible keyboard navigation
- Responsive breakpoints

Use Swiper or build custom.
description: Carousel with accessibility. Consider using a library for cross-device compatibility.

prompt:
Build a timeline component:
- Chronological event display
- Vertical or horizontal layout
- Expandable event details
- Filter by category/date
- Smooth scroll to events
- Milestone markers

Responsive for all devices.
description: Timeline component for displaying chronological data. Use CSS Grid or Flexbox for layout.

prompt:
Implement breadcrumb navigation:
- Show current page hierarchy
- Clickable parent pages
- Schema markup for SEO
- Truncate long paths on mobile
- Last item not clickable (current page)

Generate dynamically from route.
description: Breadcrumbs for site navigation. Include structured data for search engine rich results.

prompt:
Add image gallery with lightbox:
- Grid of thumbnails
- Click to open fullscreen
- Navigation arrows in lightbox
- Zoom functionality
- Close on escape or outside click
- Keyboard navigation

Lazy load images for performance.
description: Image gallery with lightbox. Consider using a library like PhotoSwipe for advanced features.

prompt:
Create a color picker component:
- Visual color selector (hue, saturation, lightness)
- HEX, RGB, HSL input fields
- Preset color swatches
- Recent colors history
- Copy to clipboard
- Opacity slider

Accessible with keyboard navigation.
description: Color picker for design tools. Consider using a library like react-color for full features.

prompt:
Add print stylesheet:
- Optimize layout for printing
- Hide navigation and footer
- Adjust colors for grayscale
- Page breaks at logical points
- Show URLs for links
- Expand collapsed content

Test in print preview.
description: Print-friendly styling. Use @media print CSS queries for print-specific styles.

prompt:
Create a progress tracker:
- Multi-step completion tracking
- Visual progress bar/circle
- Completed steps checkmark
- Lock future steps until current complete
- Save progress to resume later
- Celebration on completion

Store progress in database.
description: Progress tracking for multi-step processes. Use for onboarding, courses, or checklists.

prompt:
Create a tour/onboarding overlay:
- Step-by-step product tour
- Highlight UI elements
- Tooltips with instructions
- Skip tour option
- Remember if completed
- Trigger on first visit

Use Shepherd.js or Intro.js.
description: Interactive product tour. Guide new users through key features with highlighted tooltips.

prompt:
Build a comparison slider:
- Before/after image comparison
- Draggable slider to reveal
- Touch support for mobile
- Labels for before/after
- Smooth animations
- Lazy load images

Use react-compare-image or build custom.
description: Image comparison slider. Great for showcasing transformations or changes.

prompt:
Add tooltip/popover system:
- Show on hover or click
- Position intelligently (avoid overflow)
- Delay before showing
- Close on outside click
- Arrow pointer to anchor
- Accessible with focus trap

Use Tippy.js or Radix UI.
description: Tooltip system for contextual help. Ensure accessibility with proper ARIA labels.

prompt:
Implement skeleton screens:
- Loading placeholders for content
- Match actual content structure
- Subtle shimmer animation
- Replace with real content on load
- Different skeletons for content types
- Improve perceived performance

Better UX than spinners for content areas.
description: Skeleton screens for better loading UX. Show content structure while data loads.

use_case: Creating immersive storytelling homepage with scroll-triggered narrative
prompt: Design a narrative-driven homepage that tells a compelling brand story through scroll interactions. Story structure: (1) Opening scene: Full-screen hero with bold statement or question, cinematic entrance animation, (2) Chapter-based sections: 4-6 distinct sections each telling part of the story, Full-screen or near-full-screen sections with scroll snap, Unique visual for each chapter (image, video, or illustration), (3) Scroll-triggered reveals: Text and images fade in as user scrolls, Parallax backgrounds at different speeds, Numbers counting up when in viewport, (4) Progressive disclosure: Information revealed gradually to maintain engagement, 'Show More' expansions for deeper content, (5) Story elements: Problem > Solution > Transformation narrative arc, Emotional connection through authentic imagery, Strong conclusion with CTA as the story resolution. Use smooth scrolling and Intersection Observer API for triggers. Optimize for mobile with adapted vertical storytelling.
description: Creates engaging narrative experiences that increase time-on-page by 50%+ and emotional connection with brands. Storytelling is a key differentiator in Awwwards winners like Nomadic Tribe. Based on immersive design patterns.

use_case: Designing a homepage with gradient mesh and modern color transitions
prompt: Create a visually stunning homepage utilizing gradient meshes and smooth color transitions. Gradient implementation: (1) Gradient types: Linear gradients for backgrounds, Radial gradients for focal points, Conic gradients for dynamic effects, Mesh gradients for complex multi-color blends, Animated gradients with CSS or canvas, (2) Color strategy: 2-4 colors maximum per gradient, Use brand colors as gradient base, Add complementary colors for depth, Consider color psychology, Ensure text readability on gradients (overlay or high contrast), (3) Application areas: Hero section background, Section dividers with gradient overlays, Button hover effects, Card backgrounds with subtle gradients, Text gradients for headlines, Border gradients for modern accents, (4) Animation effects: Gradient position shifts on scroll, Rotating gradient angles, Color value interpolation, Morphing between gradient states, (5) Technical implementation: Use CSS gradients for performance, Canvas or WebGL for complex effects, Optimize gradient stops (3-5 stops ideal), Test on different displays (gradients can look different), Provide fallback solid colors. Create depth without overwhelming content. Modern trend in 2025 web design. Reference: Stripe's website, modern SaaS homepages.
description: Implements modern gradient aesthetics that create depth and visual interest. Gradient meshes are dominating 2025 design trends and appear in many award-winning sites. Creates dynamic, memorable visual experiences.

use_case: Creating a geometric pattern and shape-based homepage design
prompt: Design a modern homepage utilizing geometric shapes and patterns as core visual elements. Design system: (1) Shape library: Define 3-5 signature shapes (circles, triangles, hexagons, custom shapes), Use shapes as: Section dividers, Image masks/frames, Background patterns, Decorative accents, (2) Pattern application: Repeating geometric patterns as backgrounds, Gradient overlays on shapes, Shapes that respond to scroll or mouse position, Morphing shape transitions, (3) Color blocking: Use shapes for color section separation, Overlapping shapes with transparency, Contrast between shape colors and content, (4) Content integration: Text wrapped around custom shape paths, Images clipped to geometric shapes, Icons designed with consistent geometric style, (5) Animation: Shapes that float or rotate subtly, Entrance animations for shapes on scroll, Hover effects with shape transformations. Maintain balance - shapes should enhance, not distract from content. Use CSS clip-path and SVG for shapes. Create consistent shape system throughout design.
description: Implements contemporary geometric design trends seen in award-winning sites. Geometric patterns add visual interest and modernity while maintaining professionalism. Popular in CSS Design Awards for innovative visual approaches.

use_case: Implementing an editorial-style homepage with magazine layout aesthetics
prompt: Design a content-rich, editorial-style homepage inspired by high-end digital magazines. Layout principles: (1) Asymmetrical grid: Mix of full-width, half-width, and offset content blocks, Featured content in large hero card, Secondary content in varied-size cards, (2) Typography emphasis: Large, serif headlines (48-64px) for editorial feel, Generous line spacing (1.8-2.0), Dropcaps for article intros, Pull quotes highlighted in larger font, (3) Rich media: High-quality editorial photography, Full-bleed images that break grid, Image galleries with lightbox, Inline videos or GIFs, (4) Content hierarchy: Featured story at top, Category sections (Latest, Trending, Editor's Picks), Tag-based filtering or navigation, Author bylines with photos, Publication dates, (5) White space: Generous margins and padding, Content max-width 720px for readability. Use serif fonts like Playfair Display or Lora for sophistication. Include subtle hover effects on article cards.
description: Creates sophisticated, content-forward homepages suitable for blogs, media sites, or thought-leadership brands. Editorial design elevates perceived quality and authority, commonly seen in CSS Design Award winners for content sites.

use_case: Building a dark mode homepage with elegant light/dark theme switching
prompt: Design a stunning dark mode homepage with smooth theme switching capability. Dark mode specifications: (1) Color palette: Background: #0F172A or #1E293B (dark navy), Text: #F1F5F9 or #E2E8F0 (light gray, not pure white), Accents: Vibrant colors (blue #3B82F6, purple #A855F7, green #10B981), (2) Contrast considerations: Ensure 4.5:1 contrast ratio for readability, Reduce pure white to prevent eye strain, Use subtle borders (#334155) instead of shadows, (3) Theme toggle: Sun/moon icon toggle in header, Smooth transition animation (300ms) on theme change, Remember user preference with localStorage, Respect prefers-color-scheme media query, (4) Adapted elements: Reduce shadow intensity in dark mode, Adjust image brightness (-10% to -20%), Invert icon colors automatically, Lighten card backgrounds (#1E293B), (5) Accessibility: Test contrast in both modes, Ensure all interactive elements visible in both themes. Popular in award-winning portfolio sites like David Langarica.
description: Implements sophisticated dark mode design that's increasingly popular in award-winning sites. Dark mode reduces eye strain and is preferred by 70%+ of users in certain contexts. Shows design sophistication and user consideration.

use_case: Designing a homepage with glassmorphism and blur effects
prompt: Create a modern homepage utilizing glassmorphism design trend with frosted glass aesthetics. Glassmorphism implementation: (1) Core glass effect: Semi-transparent background (rgba with 10-30% opacity), Backdrop blur filter (10-30px), Subtle border (1px with 20-40% opacity), Light background highlights on edges, Optional subtle shadow for depth, (2) Element application: Card components, Navigation header, Modal overlays, Feature sections, Button hover states, (3) Color considerations: Works best with gradient backgrounds, Use light colors for glass elements on dark backgrounds, Use dark glass on light/colorful backgrounds, Ensure sufficient text contrast (minimum 4.5:1), (4) Layering strategy: Create depth with multiple glass layers, Vary opacity levels for hierarchy, Use blur intensity to distinguish importance, Combine with regular solid elements for balance, (5) Performance: Use backdrop-filter (check browser support), Provide fallback for unsupported browsers (solid colors), Optimize number of blur effects for performance, Test on lower-end devices. Popular in 2025 design trends. Creates modern, elegant aesthetic. Use sparingly for maximum impact. Reference: Apple's design language, macOS Big Sur aesthetics.
description: Implements trendy glassmorphism aesthetic that creates depth and sophistication. Glass effects are popular in modern UI design and award-winning sites. Creates visual interest while maintaining content readability.

use_case: Building a homepage with neumorphism soft UI elements
prompt: Design a homepage featuring neumorphism (soft UI) design style with subtle depth and shadows. Neumorphism specifications: (1) Core aesthetic: Soft, extruded elements that appear to rise from background, Same color as background with subtle variation, Dual shadows: light source (top-left) and dark shadow (bottom-right), Subtle, low contrast overall appearance, Rounded corners for all elements (16-24px), (2) Shadow formula: Light shadow: -5px -5px 10px rgba(255,255,255,0.7), Dark shadow: 5px 5px 10px rgba(0,0,0,0.2), Adjust values based on element size, Combine shadows on single element, (3) Background colors: Light mode: #e0e5ec or similar light grays, Dark mode: #2c2f33 or similar dark grays, Avoid pure white or pure black, Use slight color tints for warmth, (4) Interactive states: Pressed state: inset shadows (reverse direction), Hover: slightly increase shadow intensity, Active elements: more prominent elevation, (5) Element application: Buttons and form inputs, Card containers, Icon backgrounds, Toggle switches, Sliders and progress bars. Ensure accessibility - neumorphism can have contrast issues. Use sparingly - full neumorphism sites can be hard to read. Combine with higher contrast elements for balance.
description: Implements neumorphism soft UI trend that creates subtle, tactile interfaces. While trendy, requires careful implementation for accessibility. Best used for accent elements rather than entire layouts.

use_case: Creating an Awwwards-style homepage with optimal visual hierarchy using F-pattern layout
prompt: Design a homepage that implements the F-pattern reading flow with a focus on visual hierarchy. Start with a bold headline in the top-left corner (40-48px), followed by a compelling subheadline (18-24px). Place the primary CTA prominently in the upper-left hot spot with high-contrast colors. Use strategic white space (minimum 20% of layout) to guide the eye naturally through content. Include a secondary horizontal scan line with key benefits using icons and concise text. Ensure the design follows Awwwards' principles with size variations creating clear importance hierarchy - make headlines 2-3x larger than body text. Apply the rule of thirds for placing critical elements at grid intersections.
description: Creates award-winning homepage layouts following the F-pattern scanning behavior with optimal visual hierarchy, proven to improve comprehension by 20% through strategic spacing and element sizing. Based on NN/G research and Awwwards winners.

use_case: Designing a Z-pattern homepage layout for product showcases or portfolios
prompt: Create a homepage using the Z-pattern layout optimized for guiding users through a visual journey. Position the logo and primary navigation in the top-left, with a striking hero image or video in the top-right. Place a diagonal content flow from top-right to bottom-left using directional cues like arrows, eye-gaze imagery, or pathway illustrations. Position the main CTA button in the bottom-right corner with contrasting colors (use green for trust or orange for urgency). Include 3-4 content blocks along the Z-path with progressive disclosure. Implement smooth scroll animations that follow the Z-flow. Design should be mobile-responsive, converting to a vertical flow on smaller screens.
description: Implements the Z-pattern visual hierarchy ideal for simpler layouts and storytelling, commonly used in CSS Design Award winners. Guides users' attention diagonally across the page for maximum engagement and conversion.

use_case: Designing a card-based layout system for content-heavy homepages
prompt: Create a modern card-based homepage layout that organizes complex content intuitively. Card specifications: (1) Card structure: Rounded corners (8-12px border-radius), Subtle shadow for depth (0 2px 8px rgba(0,0,0,0.1)), Consistent padding (24-32px), White or light background on darker page background, (2) Layout options: CSS Grid with responsive columns (4 columns desktop, 2 tablet, 1 mobile), Masonry layout for varied card heights, Horizontal scroll cards on mobile for featured content, (3) Card anatomy: Icon or image at top (16:9 ratio), Headline (20-24px), Description (2-3 lines), CTA link or button at bottom, (4) Hover effects: Lift on hover (translateY(-4px)), Shadow intensification, Border color change or glow effect, (5) Content types: Feature cards, Product/service cards, Blog post previews, Team member cards, Case study cards. Ensure cards are keyboard accessible with focus states. Use semantic HTML with proper heading hierarchy within cards.
description: Implements versatile card-based design pattern that scales well for content-rich sites. Cards improve scanability and organization, commonly used in CSS Design Award winners. Provides flexible, responsive content structure.

use_case: Creating a split-screen homepage layout for dual offerings or before/after
prompt: Design a dynamic split-screen homepage that showcases two distinct offerings or contrasts. Layout structure: (1) Screen division: 50/50 vertical split on desktop, Stack vertically on mobile/tablet (each section full-width), Use clip-path or CSS Grid for clean division, (2) Left section: Distinct background color or image, Headline, description, and CTA for first offering, Hover effect: Section expands slightly (55/45 ratio), (3) Right section: Contrasting background, Parallel content structure for comparison, Mirror hover effect, (4) Middle divider: Thin divider line (2px) or none for seamless look, Optional draggable slider to reveal more of either side, Logo or icon positioned at center split, (5) Use cases: Before/After transformations, Two product tiers (Free vs. Premium), Personal vs. Business offerings, Services comparison. Ensure each side is self-contained with all necessary info. Add subtle animations on scroll reveal.
description: Creates striking visual impact through symmetry and contrast. Split-screen layouts are popular in portfolio sites and dual-offering businesses. Provides clear differentiation while maintaining visual balance.

use_case: Building a homepage with Bento Grid layout for modern, modular design
prompt: Design a contemporary homepage using the Bento Grid layout pattern popularized by Apple and modern design trends. Bento Grid structure: (1) Grid system: CSS Grid with varying cell sizes, Mix of 1x1, 1x2, 2x1, 2x2 cells, Asymmetrical but balanced layout, Consistent gap spacing (16-24px), (2) Card design: Each cell is a distinct card/module, Rounded corners (12-16px), Subtle shadows or borders for separation, Cohesive background colors (use 2-3 from palette), Padding: 24-32px, (3) Content types: Feature highlights, Product showcases, Testimonial snippets, Statistic cards, Image galleries, Video previews, CTA modules, Blog post previews, (4) Visual hierarchy: Larger cells for important content, Mix of text-heavy and image-heavy cards, Varied content types for interest, Hover effects (lift, glow) on interactive cards, (5) Responsive behavior: Reflow to fewer columns on tablet, Single column on mobile, Maintain card aspect ratios. Ensure consistent content density across cards. Use white space effectively. Reference: Apple's homepage, iOS design patterns.
description: Implements trendy Bento Grid layout that's dominating modern web design in 2025. Creates modular, scannable layouts that organize diverse content types elegantly. Popular in tech, portfolio, and design-forward brands.
